element.name: EMS Agency Unique State ID
element.definition: The unique ID assigned to the EMS Agency which is associated with all state licensure numbers and information.
element.v3Comment: This may be the EMS Agency Name or a unique number assigned by the state EMS office. This is required to document multiple license types and numbers associated with the same EMS Agency.

element.name: EMS Agency Number
element.definition: The state-assigned provider number of the responding agency
element.v3Comment: This is the primary identifier for the entire Demographic Section. Each of the Demographic sections must be associated with an EMS Agency Number. An EMS Agency can have more than one Agency Number within a state. This reflects the ability for an EMS Agency to have a different number for each service type or location (based on state implementation).

element.name: EMS Agency Name
element.definition: The formal name of the agency.

element.name: EMS Agency State
element.definition: The state/territory which assigned the EMS agency number.
element.v3Comment:
This has been clarified to reflect that it is the state in which the EMS Agency resides and the state associated with the EMS Agency number.
GNIS Codes Website: http://geonames.usgs.gov/domestic/download_data.htm

element.name: Medical Device Serial Number
element.definition: The unique manufacturer's serial number associated with a medical device.

element.name: Medical Device Name or ID
element.definition: The local number or configurable Name/ID of the medical device.

element.name: Medical Device Type
element.definition: The type of medical device.
element.v3Comment: This is multiple choice to allow documentation of various multifunction device configurations.

element.name: Medical Device Manufacturer
element.definition: The manufacturer of the medical device.

element.name: Medical Device Model Number
element.definition: The specific manufacturer's model number associated with medical device.

element.name: Patient Care Report Number
element.definition: The unique number automatically assigned by the EMS agency for each Patient Care Report (PCR). This should be a unique number for the EMS agency for all of time.

element.name: Last Name
element.definition: The patient's last (family) name
element.v3Comment: Pertinent negatives accepted with option of "Unable to Complete" or "Refused".

element.name: First Name
element.definition: The patient's first (given) name
element.v3Comment: Pertinent negatives accepted with option of "Unable to Complete" or "Refused".

element.name: Middle Initial/Name
element.definition: The patient's middle name, if any

element.name: Gender
element.definition: The Patient's Gender

element.name: Race
element.definition: The patient's race as defined by the OMB (US Office of Management and Budget)
element.v3Comment:
OMB requirements are provided at: http://www.omhrc.gov/templates/browse.aspx?lvl=2&lvlID=172. Using single multiple choice question methodology to improve the completion of ethnicity information.
Ethnicity (Version 2.2.1: E06_13) has been merged with this data element and retired.

choice.description: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

element.name: Age
element.definition: The patient's age (either calculated from date of birth or best approximation)

element.name: Age Units
element.definition: The unit used to define the patient's age

element.name: Date of Birth
element.definition: The patient's date of birth

element.name: Date/Time Vital Signs Taken
element.definition: The date/time vital signs were taken on the patient.
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Cardiac Rhythm / Electrocardiography (ECG)
element.definition: The cardiac rhythm / ECG and other electrocardiography findings of the patient as interpreted by EMS personnel.

element.name: ECG Type
element.definition: The type of ECG associated with the cardiac rhythm.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

element.name: Method of ECG Interpretation
element.definition: The method of ECG interpretation.
element.v3Comment: "Transmission with no interpretation" may be used by EMS Agency Personnel that are not trained to interpret cardiac rhythms.
element.v3Changes: Added to better document ECG results.

element.name: SBP (Systolic Blood Pressure)
element.definition: The patient's systolic blood pressure.
element.v3Comment: Required for ACS-Field Triage and other patient scoring systems.

element.name: DBP (Diastolic Blood Pressure)
element.definition: The patient's diastolic blood pressure.
element.v3Comment:
Diastolic blood pressure pattern allows for the following values:
1) A number 0 through 500
2) P
3) p

element.name: Method of Blood Pressure Measurement
element.definition: Indication of method of blood pressure measurement.

element.name: Mean Arterial Pressure
element.definition: The patient's mean arterial pressure.
element.v3Changes: Added for additional patient monitoring capability.

element.name: Heart Rate
element.definition: The patient's heart rate expressed as a number per minute.
element.v3Comment: Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate have been merged with an additional data element for Method of Heart Rate Measurement.

element.name: Method of Heart Rate Measurement
element.definition: The method in which the Heart Rate was measured. Values include auscultated, palpated, electronic monitor).
element.v3Comment: This data element was added when Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate were merged as EVitals.10.
element.v3Changes: This data element was added when Pulse Rate and Electronic Monitor Rate were merged as EVitals.10.

element.name: Pulse Oximetry
element.definition: The patient's oxygen saturation.

element.name: Respiratory Rate
element.definition: The patient's respiratory rate expressed as a number per minute.

element.name: Carbon Dioxide (CO2)
element.definition: The patient's end-tidal or other CO2 level.

element.name: Carbon Monoxide (CO)
element.definition: The patient's carbon monoxide level measured in parts per million (ppm).
element.v3Changes: Added to allow use of a new patient monitoring device

element.name: Blood Glucose Level
element.definition: The patient's blood glucose level.

element.name: Temperature
element.definition: The patient's body temperature in degrees Celsius/centigrade.

element.name: Temperature Method
element.definition: The method used to obtain the patient's body temperature.

element.name: Date/Time of Laboratory or Imaging Result
element.definition: The data and time for the specific laboratory result
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration
element.v3Changes: Added to better document patient care.

element.name: Laboratory Result Type
element.definition: The type of the laboratory value.
element.v3Changes: Added to provide for the documentation of laboratory results obtained prior to or during and EMS patient encounter.

element.name: Laboratory Result
element.definition: The value or result of the laboratory test (Units may vary).
element.v3Changes: Added to better document EMS care.

element.name: Imaging Study Type
element.definition: The type of x-ray or imaging study.
element.v3Changes: Added to better describe the EMS patient care.

element.name: Imaging Study Results
element.definition: The description or interpretation of the results of the imaging study.
element.v3Changes: Added to better describe the EMS Patient Care

element.name: Imaging Study File or Waveform Graphic Type
element.definition: The type of file or waveform the imaging file is stored in.
element.v3Comment: Added to better document patient care. Added to allow the type of imaging file uploaded to be identified.

element.name: Imaging Study File or Waveform Graphic
element.definition: The imaging study file.
element.v3Comment: Added to allow the imaging file to be uploaded and better document patient care.

element.name: Medical Device Serial Number
element.definition: The unique manufacturer's serial number associated with a medical device.

element.name: Date/Time of Event (per Medical Device)
element.definition: The time of the event recorded by the device's internal clock
element.v3Comment:
DateTime consists of finite-length characters of the form: yyyy '-' mm '-' dd 'T' hh ':' mm ':' ss ('.' s+)? (zzzzzz)
yyyya four-digit numeral that represents the year
'-'separators between parts of the date portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the month
dda two-digit numeral that represents the day
Tseparator that indicates time-of-day follows
hha two-digit numeral that represents the hour
':'a separator between parts of the time-of-day portion
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minute
ssa two-integer-digit numeral that represents the whole seconds
'.' s+(not required) represents the fractional seconds
zzzzzz(required) represents the timezone (as described below)
Timezones, required, are durations with (integer-valued) hour and minute properties in the form: ('+' | '-') hh ':' mm
hha two-digit numeral (with leading zeros as required) that represents the hours
mma two-digit numeral that represents the minutes
'+'a nonnegative duration
'-'a nonpositive duration

element.name: Medical Device Event Type
element.definition: The type of event documented by the medical device.
element.v3Comment: Can be displayed in the Vital Signs or Procedure Sections.

element.name: Medical Device Waveform Graphic Type
element.definition: The type of waveform file stored in Waveform Graphic

element.name: Medical Device Waveform Graphic
element.definition: The graphic waveform file.

element.name: Medical Device Mode (Manual, AED, Pacing, CO2, O2, etc)
element.definition: The mode of operation the device is operating in during the defibrillation, pacing, or rhythm analysis by the device (if appropriate for the event)

element.name: Medical Device ECG Lead
element.definition: The lead or source which the medical device used to obtain the rhythm (if appropriate for the event)
element.v3Comment: Can be displayed in the Vital Signs or Procedure Sections.

element.name: Medical Device ECG Interpretation
element.definition: The interpretation of the rhythm by the device (if appropriate for the event)
element.v3Comment: The rhythm interpretation text imported from the device.

element.name: Type of Shock
element.definition: The type of shock used by the device for the defibrillation (if appropriate for the event)

element.name: Shock or Pacing Energy
element.definition: The energy (in joules) used for the shock or pacing (if appropriate for the event)

element.name: Total Number of Shocks Delivered
element.definition: The number of times the patient was defibrillated, if the patient was defibrillated during the patient encounter.

element.name: Pacing Rate
element.definition: The rate the device was calibrated to pace during the event, if appropriate.

element.name: Custom Data Element Title
element.definition: This is the title of the custom data element created to collect information that is not defined formally in NEMSIS Version 3.
element.v3Comment: This is grouped with all data elements in this section and can have multiple instances.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Definition
element.definition: The definition of the custom element and how it should be used.

element.name: Custom Data Type
element.definition: The data type of the custom element.

element.name: Custom Data Element Recurrence
element.definition: Indication if the data element will accept multiple values.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Usage
element.definition: The Usage (Mandatory, Required, or Optional) for the Custom Data Element.
element.v3Comment:
Mandatory = Must be completed and will not accept null values
Required = Must be completed but will accept null values
Optional = Not required but if collected, it cannot be a null value.
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Potential Values
element.definition: The values which are associated with the Custom Data Element. Values would be the choices provided to the user when they document the Custom Data Element
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Result
element.definition: The actual value or values chosen (if values listed in custom.05) or result (free text, Date/Time, or number) documented for the Custom Data Element
element.v3Changes: Added to allow customized data elements to be inserted and collected from within the NEMSIS Version 3 standard.

element.name: Custom Data Element Reference
element.definition: Refers to the data element being extended by referencing the correlationID attribute in the element eCustomConfiguration.CustomGroup

element.name: Custom Correlation ID
element.definition: Correlation id used to map back to set of other elements in other sections.
